alert.note: Alert for Fayette (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:23PM CDT until July 21 at 5:00PM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM CDT FOR NORTH CENTRAL MARSHALL...NORTH CENTRAL TIPPAH...NORTHERN BENTON...EAST CENTRAL TIPTON...FAYETTE...HARDEMAN...WESTERN MCNAIRY...HAYWOOD...SOUTHERN MADISON AND WESTERN CHESTER COUNTIES... At 220 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Nutbush to 6 miles east of Somerville to near Slayden, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Jackson, Brownsville, Henderson, Bolivar, Selmer, Chickasaw State Forest, Big Hill Pond State Park, Chickasaw State Park, Whiteville, Somerville, Silerton, Mt Pleasant, Masseyville, Hillville, Michigan City, Pocahontas, Bemis, Lagrange, Dancyville and Cloverport. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. This is a DANGEROUS SITUATION. These storms are producing widespread wind damage across Fayette County and southern Haywood County. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
